title: Quiz 1 - Ratio and Proportion
instruction: Given below are two quantities named I & II. Based on the given information, you have to determine the relation between the two quantities.

quiz.text: One year ago the ratio of Ramu and Somu age was 6 : 7 respectively. Four years hence their ratio would become 7 :8, How old is Somu?
options: 24 years
30 years
32 years
36 years
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of money is to be distributed among A, B, C, D in the proportion of 5 : 2 : 4 : 3 If C gets Rs. 1000 more than D, what is B’s share?
options: Rs. 500
Rs. 1500
Rs. 2000
Rs. 2400
None of these

quiz.text: Two numbers are in the ratio 3 :5 If 9 is subtracted from each, then new numbers are in the ratio 12 : 23, The smaller number is :
options: 27
33
49
55
None of these

quiz.text: If a number is reduced by 40% it become two third of another number. What is ratio of the second number to first number?
options: 6 : 10
9 : 8
8 : 9
9 : 10
None of these

quiz.text: If P : Q = 8 : 15 and Q : R = 3 : 2, then find P : Q : R?
options: 8 : 15 : 7
7 : 15 : 8
8 : 15 : 10
10 : 15 : 8
None of these

quiz.text: If P : Q = 8 : 15, Q : R = 5 : 8 and R : S = 4 : 5, then P : S is equal to:
options: 4 : 15
2 : 15
3 : 19
7 : 15
None of these

quiz.text: The salaries of A, B, C are in the ratio 2 : 3 : 5 . If the increments of 15%, 10% and 20% are allowed respectively in their salaries, then what will be the new ratio of their salaries?
options: 3 : 3 : 10
10 : 11 : 20
23 : 33 : 60
25 : 27 : 29
None of these

quiz.text: If Rs. 782 be divided into three parts, proportional to  then the first part is:
options: Rs. 182
Rs. 190
Rs. 196
Rs. 204
None of these

quiz.text: Two numbers are in the ratio 1 :2, If 7 is added to both, they changes to 3 :5 The greatest number is:
options: 24
26
28
32
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of three numbers is 3 : 4 : 5 and the sum of their squares is 1250. The sum of the numbers is :
options: 30
50
60
90
None of these

quiz.text: Sachin is younger than Rahul by 4 years. If their ages are in the respective ratio of 7 : 9, how old is Sachin?
options: 16 years
18 years
14 years
15 years
None of these

quiz.text: At present, the ratio between the ages of Arun and Deepak is 4 :3, After 6 years. Arun’s age will be 26 years. What is the age of Deepak at present?
options: 12 years
15 years
19 years
21 years
None of these

quiz.text: Present ages of X and Y are in the ratio 5 : 6 respectively. Seven year hence this ratio will become 6 :7 respectively. What is X’s present age in years?
options: 35
42
49
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text: Present ages of Sameer and Anand are in the ratio of 5 : 4 respectively. Three years hence, the ratio of their ages will become 11 : 9 respectively. What is Anand’s present age in years?
options: 24
27
40
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text: The total of the ages of Jayant, Prem and Saransh is 93 years. Ten years ago, the ratio of their ages was 2 : 3 : 4 respectively. What is the present age of Saransh?
options: 24 years
32 years
34 years
38 years
None of these

quiz.text: Hitesh is 40 years old and Ronnie is 60 years old. How many years ago was the ratio of their ages 3 : 5?
options: 5 years
10 years
20 years
37 years
None of these

quiz.text: The difference between a two-digit number and the number obtained by interchanging the digits is 36. What is the difference between the sum and the difference of the digits of the number if the ratio between the digits of the number is 1 : 2 ?
options: 4
8
16
20
None of these

quiz.text: Seats for Mathematics, Physics and Biology in a school are in the ratio 5 : 7 :8. There is a proposal to increase these seats by 40%, 50% and 75% respectively. What will be the ratio of increased seats?
options: 2 : 3 : 4
6 : 7 : 8
6 : 8 : 9
4 : 8 : 9
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of the number of boys and girls in a college is 7 :8. If the percentage increase in the number of boys and girls be 20% and 10% respectively, what will be the new ratio?
options: 8 : 9
17 : 18
21 : 22
Can’t be determined
None of these

quiz.text: Salaries of Ravi and Sumit are in the ratio 2 :3. If the salary of each is increased by Rs. 4000, the new ratio becomes 40 : 57. What is Sumit’s salary?
options: Rs. 17,000
Rs. 20,000
Rs. 25,500
Rs. 34,000
None of these

quiz.text: The salaries of A, B and C are in the ratio 2 : 3 :5. If the increments of 15%, 10% and 20% are allowed respectively in their salaries, then what will be new ratio of their salaries?
options: 3 : 3 : 10
10 : 11 : 20
23 : 33 : 60
3 : 4 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: In a bag, there are coins of 25 p, 10 p and 5 p in the ratio of 2 : 3 :4. If there is Rs. 50 in all, how many 5 p coins are there?
options: 50
100
50
200
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of money is divided among C, A and B in ratio of 4 : 5 : 6 and another sum of money is divided between M and N equally if B got 2000 more than M then how much C get?
options: Rs. 1000
Rs. 500
Rs. 4000
Can't be determined
None of these

quiz.text: Three number A, B and C are in ratio of 12 : 15 : 25. If sum of these numbers be 364 find the ratio between difference of B and A and the difference of C and B?
options: 3 : 2
3 : 10
3 : 5
4 : 2
None of these

quiz.text: In a bag, there are coins of 25 p, 10 p and 5 p in the ratio of 1 : 2 :3. If there are Rs. 30 in all, how many 5 p coins are there?
options: 50
100
150
200
None of these

quiz.text: If Rs. 510 be divided among A, B, C in such a way that A gets of what B gets and B gets  of what C gets, then their shares are respectively:
options: Rs. 120, Rs. 240, Rs. 150
Rs. 60, Rs. 90, Rs. 360
Rs. 150, Rs. 300, Rs. 60
Rs. 70, Rs. 90, Rs. 350
None of these

quiz.text: Rs. 366 are divided among A, B and C so that A may get  as much as B and C together, B may get  as much as A and C together, then the share of A is :
options: Rs. 122
Rs. 129.60
Rs. 1460
Rs. 183
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of the earnings of A and B is 4 :7. If the earnings A increase by 50% and those of B decrease by 25%, the new ratio of their earnings becomes 8 :7. What are A’s earnings?
options: Rs. 21,000
Rs. 26,000
Rs. 28,000
Data inadequate
None of these

quiz.text: An amount of Rs. 735 was divided between A, B and C. If each of them had received Rs. 25 less, their shares would have been in the ratio of 1 : 3 :2. The money received by C was :
options: Rs. 195
Rs. 200
Rs. 225
Rs. 245
None of these

quiz.text: An amount of Rs. 2430 is divided among A, B and C such that if their shares be reduced by Rs. 5, Rs. 10 and Rs. 15 respectively, the remainders shall be in the ratio of 3 : 4 :5. Then, B’s share was:
options: Rs. 605
Rs. 790
Rs. 800
Rs. 810
None of these

quiz.text: Gold is 19 times as heavy as water and copper is 9 times as heavy as water. In what ratio should these be mixed to get an alloy 15 times as heavy as water?
options: 1 : 1
2 : 3
1 : 2
3 : 2
None of these

quiz.text: 15 litres of mixture contains 20% alcohol and the rest water. If 3 litres of water is mixed with it, the percentage of alcohol in the new mixture would be :
options: 15%
17%
18
None of these

quiz.text: 85 L of a mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 27 :7. How much more water is to be added to get a new mixture containing milk and water in the ratio 3:1 ?
options: 5 L
6.5 L
7.25 L
8 L
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of the number of boys and girls in a school is 3 :2. If 20% of the boys and 25% of the girls are scholarship holders, what percentage of the students does not get the scholarship?
options: 56
70
78
80
None of these

quiz.text: Three containers have volumes in the ratio 3 : 4 :5. They are full of mixtures of milk and water. The mixtures contain milk and water in the ratio of 4 : 1, 3:1 and 5 : 2 respectively. The contents of all these three containers are poured into a fourth container. The ratio of milk and water in the fourth container is:
options: 4 : 1
151 : 48
157 : 53
5 : 2
None of these

quiz.text: In KITM, 320 students were placed in at most 2 companies, which is 136 less than the number of students in HCTM who were placed in at least 5 companies. Find the ratio of total number of students in KITM and HCTM.
options: 3 : 5
4 : 11
2 : 3
2 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: Find the difference in number of students who were placed in at least 4 companies and that of in at least 3 companies in college LPU if its total strength is 850.
options: 105
201
160
102
None of these

quiz.text: Which college records the maximum number of students who were placed in at least 4 companies provided that the strength of all colleges is 1500 ?
options: LPU
GITM
MMU
HCTM
KITM

quiz.text: Total number of students placed in 5 companies in KITM is same as that of in HCTM. If 135 students of HCTM were placed in 1 company, then find total strength of KITM.
options: 2750
2680
2700
2500
None of these

quiz.text: LPU and MMU both has total strength of 1600 students each. Find the average number of students from both college who got placed in at most 2 companies ?
options: 448
488
484
450
None of these

quiz.text: If the total profit in Industrial sector is Rs.81000, then find the ratio of investment by Aditya in Finance to Industrial Sector.
options: 3 : 7
7 : 3
5 : 9
9 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: In telecom sector profit earned by Aditya, Veer and Sushant is in the ratio 4 : 5 : 3. Total amount invested by Aditya and Veer is Rs.14000 but Aditya invested for 8 month and Veer invested for 10 months. Find the period that Sushant invested his amount?
options: 7 Months
5 Months
6 Months
9 Months
Can’t be determined

quiz.text: If the average of total profit earned in Energy sector by all three businessmen is Rs.132000, then amount invested by Aditya is what percentage of the total money invested by all three businessmen in Energy Sector?
options: 41%
33%
25%
18.67%
Can’t be determined

quiz.text: In technology sector, ratio of time given by Aditya, Veer and Sushant is 4 : 3 : 5 and average of total investment is Rs.19000, then what will be the average profit made by all three businessmen?
options: Rs.148000
Rs.185000
Rs.160000
None of these
Can’t be determined

quiz.text: Total investment made by Aditya in Finance is what percentage more than the investment made by Veer in Energy sector?
options: 175%
133
75%
33
None of these

quiz.text:
There are two jars A and B each have quantity 100 ml. In Jar A there is 35% Alcohol and rest is water . In Jar B there is 40% Alcohol and rest is water. If 20% of the solution from first Jar is replaced with water and 25% of the solution from second jar is replaced with pure Alcohol

Quantity I – Quantity of water in Jar A

Quantity II– the sum of Quantity of alcohol from Jar A and the quantity of water from Jar B
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I – Amount of acid was drawn off initially. Several litres of acid were drawn off a 54-litre vessel full of acid and an equal amount of water was added. Again the same volume of the mixture was drawn off and replaced by water. As a result, the vessel contained 24 litres of pure acid.

Quantity II – Amount of tea worth Rs 25 per kg  blended with 30 kg of tea worth Rs 30 per kg so that by selling the blended variety at Rs 30.25 per kg there is a gain of 10%.

Note: Compare the magnitudes of both quantities.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I: Share of B if Three partners A, B and C agree to divide the profits or losses in ratio 1.50 : 1.75 : 2.25. Profit earned at the end of year is 66,000.

Quantity II: 22000
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Capacities of three vessels A, B and C are the ratio 3 : 4 : 5 respectively. A, B and C are filled with water, honey and milk respectively and then contents of these vessels are poured into a larger vessel D. Now A, B and C are again filled with milk, water and honey respectively and then contents of these vessels are poured again into D. If we add 20 liters of milk in vessel D, the quantities of milk and honey in vessel D will become equal.

Quantity I: Capacity of vessel A in liters.

Quantity II: 80 liters.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Capacities of three vessels A, B and C are in the ratio 2 : 3 : 5 respectively. First, vessel A is filled with milk and then content of vessel A is poured into vessel B. Now vessel B is filled with water then content of vessel B is poured into vessel C. Now vessel C is filled with milk. Quantity of milk in vessel C is 45 liters more than that water in vessel C. 

Quantity I: Capacity of vessel C in liters.

Quantity II: 60 liters.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation
